metadata.title: CVE-2017-3144 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
A vulnerability stemming from failure to properly clean up closed OMAPIconnections can lead to exhaustion of the pool of socket descriptorsavailable to the DHCP server. Affects ISC DHCP 4.1.0 to 4.1-ESV-R15, 4.2.0to 4.2.8, 4.3.0 to 4.3.6. Older versions may also be affected but are wellbeyond their end-of-life (EOL). Releases prior to 4.1.0 have not beentested.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-3144` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

isc-dhcp-client - 4.3.3-5ubuntu12.9
isc-dhcp-client-ddns - 4.3.3-5ubuntu12.9
isc-dhcp-common - 4.3.3-5ubuntu12.9
isc-dhcp-relay - 4.3.3-5ubuntu12.9
isc-dhcp-server - 4.3.3-5ubuntu12.9
isc-dhcp-server-ldap - 4.3.3-5ubuntu12.9
No subscription required

criterions.comment: isc-dhcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.3.3-5ubuntu12.9').
